EmailTemplate.subject: Thank You for Joining Pivotal at Devoxx Belgium 2015
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Thanks for joining Pivotal and the Spring IO community at Devoxx Belgium. We hope you enjoyed learning how enterprises are adopting Cloud Native application architectures to drive modern, software experiences for their customers. If you’d like a hands on workshop day in your offices or at a nearby hotel, simply inquire here <http://pivotal.io/cloud-native-workshop> to begin a discussion.
In the meantime, start your Cloud Native journey on the Cloud Native microsite <http://pivotal.io/cloud-native-workshop> to learn why it matters, what it looks like and how to become Cloud Native. If you didn't manage to get one at the conference, you can also get a complimentary, digital copy of Matt Stine's book on Cloud Native applications <http://pivotal.io/platform/migrating-to-cloud-native-application-architectures-ebook> to learn how to architect and write Cloud Native applications, as well as understand how to deploy and manage them. In case you missed anything, here’s a quick recap:
- Live replays from Spring IO engineers at Pivotal:
- The can’t miss session of Devoxx 2015: Josh Long on Getting Started with Spring Cloud <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SFDYdslOvu8> - Brian Clozel and Stéphane Nicoll gave a University talk on Spring Boot for the Web Tier <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7cemYpV1fNI> - Jüergen Höeller teaches us Modern Component Design with Spring Framework 4.2 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Innj76v7TxI> - Jüergen Höeller spoke about the Spring Framework 5.0 Roadmap <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xNUcR4DSDz0> - Oliver Gierke spoke about What’s new in Spring Data <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVB2AmMRUBI> - Brian Clozel hosted a quick session on HTTP/2 For The Web Developer <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ssp1ve_A1to> - Josh Long’s Interview <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kZ0PzY8mw4s> with Oracle’s Stephen Chin at Devoxx
More Devoxx recordings will be made available here <https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCBVCTuk6uJrN3iFV_3vurg> over time.
Hungry for more? If you’re over all of the Microservices hype and want to learn about Cloud Native Java technology, developed in partnership with NetflixOSS team, check out these resources:
- Spring Blog: Configuring it it all out by Josh Lon <https://spring.io/blog/2015/01/13/configuring-it-all-out-or-12-factor-app-style-configuration-with-spring>g - Spring Blog: 12 Factor App Style backing Services <https://spring.io/blog/2015/01/27/12-factor-app-style-backing-services-with-spring-and-cloud-foundry>
- Pivotal POV blog: Now Available—Spring Cloud Services for Pivotal Cloud Foundry <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/now-available-spring-cloud-services-for-pivotal-cloud-foundry?utm_source=InfoQ-sponsored-post-newsltr&utm_medium=sponsored-update&utm_campaign=infoq-spring-cloud-services-blog>
- Pivotal POV blog: A Quick Look at Spring Cloud Data Flow <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-perspectives/features/a-quick-look-at-spring-cloud-data-flow?utm_source=InfoQ-sponsored-post-newsltr&utm_medium=sponsored-update&utm_campaign=infoq-quick-look-spring-cloud-services-blog> - SpringOne2GX 2015 replay: 12 Factor, or Cloud Native Apps for Spring Developers <https://spring.io/blog/2015/10/19/springone2gx-2015-replay-12-factor-or-cloud-native-apps-for-spring-developers> - SpringOne2GX 2015 replay: Getting Started with Spring Cloud <https://spring.io/blog/2015/10/19/springone2gx-2015-replay-getting-started-with-spring-cloud> - SpringOne2GX 2015 replay: Developer Experience with Spring Cloud <https://spring.io/blog/2015/10/22/springone2gx-2015-replay-developer-experience-with-spring-cloud> - SpringOne2GX 2015 replay: Spring Cloud at Netflix <https://spring.io/blog/2015/10/19/springone2gx-2015-replay-spring-cloud-at-netflix>
- Stay in touch with Pivotal and join the conversation on our blogs <http://spring.io/blog>, podcasts <http://blog.pivotal.io/podcasts-pivotal>, and on Twitter <https://twitter.com/springcentral>.
We hope to see you again soon at a future event <https://pivotal.io/news-events>!
Thank you, The Spring Team at Pivotal
